title: President Trump Reacts To Deadly Campus Shooting, Rhode Island | 10 News
description: US President Donald Trump described the Brown University shooting as “a terrible thing” during remarks to the media on Saturday night.  Returning to the White House from the annual Army-Navy football game, the president said he had been briefed on the situation.  “All we can do right now is pray for the victims and for those that were very badly hurt,” he added.  Two people were killed and another nine injured after a shooter struck Brown University’s Barus & Holley Engineering Building on Saturday night, where exams were taking place.  Police are still searching for the suspect, releasing CCTV footage of a man dressed in all black. title: Trump Condemns Deadly Attack That Killed Two U.S. Soldiers in Syria | 10 News
description: U.S. President Donald Trump has condemned an attack that killed two U.S. Army soldiers and a civilian interpreter on Saturday.  A suspected Islamic State attacker targeted a convoy of American and Syrian forces, according to the U.S. military, with reports suggesting the attacker was also a member of the Syrian security forces.  A Syrian Interior Ministry spokesperson told state-run television that the man did not hold a leadership role in the security forces.  Another three U.S. soldiers were also wounded in the attack, according to the U.S. military's Central Command.  Speaking to reporters in Washington later that day, President Trump said, “We will retaliate. Thank you very much.”  The attack took place in an area not controlled by the Syrian government. title: Brown University Shooting, Allergic Reaction To Sunscreen, Supermarket Price Gouging Ban | 10 News+
description: A gunman is on the run following a shooting at Brown University in Rhode Island, USA which left at least two dead and nine injured. 10 News+ spoke to Shamsah Amersi, whose son Jaden is a Brown University student currently hiding in a closet as the campus remains in lockdown.  The MP expenses scandal is growing, with the Attorney-General insisting she will repay part of a family trip to Western Australia, after an independent watchdog deemed that travel to be outside parliamentary rules. Communications Minister Annika Wells’ spending is still being reviewed, while Health Minister Mark Butler has been revealed to have used taxpayer funds to take his wife and son to sporting events.  Two boys have been left with blisters and burns on their faces after using Cancer Council’s new Everyday Value sunscreen. The GP says the brothers developed an allergic reaction. Consumer advocate CHOICE found that the brand of sunscreen the children used fell short of their advertised SPF of 50. Cancer Council told 10 News+ in a statement, “Allergic reactions to sunscreens occur in a very low proportion of the population… We are sorry to hear about this family’s experience”.  London’s police force has announced it will not take further action over claims that Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, the former Prince, asked his personal bodyguard to dig up information on the late Jeffrey Epstein victim Virginia Giuffre in 2011. Guiffre accused Andrew of sexually abusing her when she was a teenager, a claim which the disgraced royal has always denied. title: Man Tackles And Disarms Bondi Beach Shooter
description: Extraordinary vision reportedly taken from the scene of the Bondi Beach shooting appears to a show a man heroically tackling and disarming one of the shooters.  Vision circulating social media shows an unidentified bystander approaching the gunman, who had just discharged his weapon, before tackling the assailant and wrestling his weapon away.  At least four people are confirmed dead in the Bondi Beach shooting at the time of writing.  Watch 10 News live now for rolling coverage. title: Drone Vision Shows Bondi Gunman | 10 News
description: WARNING: GRAPHIC FOOTAGE.  More footage has emerged from the mass shooting at Bondi Beach in Sydney.  Vision shot from a drone shows the two shooters on a bridge in the area, one of them shooting his weapon, the other laying on the ground motionless (blurred).  Police have confirmed 10 people have died in the shooting, one of the dead a gunman, the other is in a critical condition in hospital under police custody. title: NSW Police And Premier Address Media, Bondi Beach Shooting Declared A Terrorism Attack | 10 News
description: #Breaking : The shooting at Bondi Beach has been designated an act of terrorism by NSW Police, who are continuing to investigate the incident.   At least 12 people have been killed, including one of the two shooters.   29 people have been taken to hospital, including two police officers. title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese Responds To Shooting At Bondi Beach Hanukkah Celebration | 10 News
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has confirmed that the national security committee was convened in response to the Bondi Beach shooting earlier this afternoon.  He described the attack as an act of “evil antisemitism” and said that Australians will come together in response.
